    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public CompletionStage<State> getStatus()
        Description copied from interface: Projections
        Read an eventually consistent copy of the projections and workers running on the service. Invocations to this method return a local copy of the `State` so multiple invocations in different nodes of the cluster may return different versions of `State` when it is evolving (e.g. during a rolling upgrade, while attending a user request to stop/start,...)
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface Projections
        Returns:
        an eventually consistent list of projections' metadata

      • startAllWorkers

        public void startAllWorkers(String projectionName)
        Description copied from interface: Projections
        Given a `projectionName`, request all its workers to start. This method returns immediately. Eventually, the request will propagate across the cluster and, after that, workers participating on that projection will start. To track the actual state of the workers, poll the projection registry using the method `getStatus`.
        Specified by:
        startAllWorkers in interface Projections

      • startWorker

        public void startWorker(String projectionName,
                        String tagName)
        Description copied from interface: Projections
        Given a `projectionName` and a `tagName` request a single worker to start. This method returns immediately. Eventually, the request will propagate across the cluster and reach the node where that particular worker must be allocated allocated. Then, the worker will be started, it's status change will be observed and propagated back across the cluster. To track the actual state of the workers, poll the projection registry using the method `getStatus`.
        Specified by:
        startWorker in interface Projections

      • stopAllWorkers

        public void stopAllWorkers(String projectionName)
        Description copied from interface: Projections
        Given a `projectionName`, request all its workers to stop. This method returns immediately. Eventually, the request will propagate across the cluster and, after that, workers participating on that projection will stop. To track the actual state of the workers, poll the projection registry using the method `getStatus`.
        Specified by:
        stopAllWorkers in interface Projections

      • stopWorker

        public void stopWorker(String projectionName,
                       String tagName)
        Description copied from interface: Projections
        Given a `projectionName` and a `tagName` request a single worker to stop. This method returns immediately. Eventually, the request will propagate across the cluster and reach the node where that particular worker is currently allocated. Then, the worker will be stopped, it's status change will be observed and propagated back across the cluster. To track the actual state of the workers, poll the projection registry using the method `getStatus`.
        Specified by:
        stopWorker in interface Projections
